paper_title.en: A combinatorial approach to doubly transitive permutation groups

description.en: Let G be a doubly but not triply transitive group on a set X. We give an algorithm to construct the orbits of G acting on X x X x X by combining those of its stabilizer H of a point of X if the group H is given first, we compute the orbits of its transitive extension G, if it exists. We apply our algorithm to G = PSL(m, q) and Sp(2m, 2), m >= 3, successfully. We go forward to compute the transitive extension of G itself. In our construction we use a superscheme defined by the orbits of H on X x X x X and do not use group elements. (c) 2007 Elsevier B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: A Computation of Some Multiply Homogeneous Superschemes from Transitive Permutation Groups

description.en: Let G be a doubly transitive permutation group on a set X. A doubly homogeneous superscheme is formed by the orbits on the set of triples of X of G. Let a be a point of a set X and let H be a transitive group on X\{alpha}. Then from the combinatorial structure of the superscheme formed by the orbits of H on X(3), we may construct some doubly homogeneous superschemes on X. We will give a general algorithm to compute such superschemes and show how to implement it practically. In particular if H = G(alpha), the stabilizer of alpha in G, then we can construct a superscheme of which automorphism group is G in the cases of moderate size. Furthermore, even if H is not a stabilizer of a doubly transitive group, we can consider some orbit-like sets of a doubly homogeneous superscheme. We see whether such sets form a design in some cases. As a related combinatorial algorithm we have developed a program to compute the automorphism group of a superscheme which is a kind of a labeled hyper graph.

paper_title.en: Existence theorems of quasiperiodic solutions to nonlinear differential difference equations(Theory)

description.ja: In this research, we consider a quasiperiodic system of nonlinear differential difference equations. We prove a new theorem to solve these equations. It says that one can always assure the existence of quasiperiodic solution by checking several conditions on an obtained approximate solution and further give a method to obtain an error bound of the approximate solution. The approximate solutions are constructed by the method of Galerkin's procedure based on trigonometric polynomials. We carry out some numerical experiments using the method of Galerkin's procedure.
description.en: In this research, we consider a quasiperiodic system of nonlinear differential difference equations. We prove a new theorem to solve these equations. It says that one can always assure the existence of quasiperiodic solution by checking several conditions on an obtained approximate solution and further give a method to obtain an error bound of the approximate solution. The approximate solutions are constructed by the method of Galerkin's procedure based on trigonometric polynomials. We carry out some numerical experiments using the method of Galerkin's procedure.

paper_title.en: Classification of association schemes of small order

description.en: This paper enumerates the isomorphism classes of association schemes of order 20-28 by using the computer. It also classifies all the association schemes of order 24-28 whether their automorphism groups are transitive or not, and whether they are group case or not. Some more properties of the obtained association schemes are computed. © 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

description.en: This paper enumerates the isomorphism classes of association schentes of order 20-28 by using the computer, it also classifies all the association schemes of order 24-28 whether their automorphism groups are transitive or not, and whether they are group case or not. Some more properties of the obtained association schemes are computed. (C) 2002 Elsevier Science B.V. All rights reserved.

paper_title.en: Parallel backtrack computing of association schemes using classroom PC's

description.en: A parallel backtrack search visits its searching tree in a breadth-first fashion. The nodes at each level are visited parallel by the processors and again their children are redistributed among the processors. A cluster of classroom PC's is not suitable for parallel computing, because its communication capacity is not so rich or reliable. In this paper we introduce a method to search the subtree rooted by the node distributed to each processor in a depth-first fashion with a certain time limit. If there remain some subtrees not visited thoroughly, then we collect the nodes which are the roots of the subtrees and redistribute the children of these nodes in the next step. This reduces the times of sending messages among the processors. We apply this method to computing association schemes. We also show what data is stored in order to restart the parallel computation when it is interrupted.

publisher.en: WORLD SCIENTIFIC PUBL CO PTE LTD

paper_title.en: Parallet backtrack computing of association schemes using classroom PC's
Computing isomorphisms of association schemes and its application

description.en: Isomorphisms of association schemes are isomorphisms of edge-labeled regular graphs permitting to permute the labels. We give an algorithm computing isomorphisms of association schemes using their algebraic property. We also study an application of computing isomorphisms of association schemes to computing normalizers of permutation groups. (C) 2001 Academic Press.

description.en: Isomorphisms of association schemes are isomorphisms of edge-labeled regular graphs permitting to permute the labels.
